means: 不开心的，生气的，被得罪了的
冒犯，使生气，使不愉快( displease的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was not displeased at the way he had handled the meeting.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对他主持会议的方式并无不满。

sentence.Network_en: Businessmen are displeased with erratic economic policy-making.
sentence.Network_cn: 商界人士对变化无常的经济决策很是恼火。

sentence.Network_en: The old man was displeased and darted an angry look at me.
sentence.Network_cn: 老人不高兴了,瞪了我一眼.

entry.tran: 不高兴的;厌烦的;生气的
entry.def: If you are displeased with something, you are annoyed or rather angry about it.

example.ex: Businessmen are displeased with erratic economic policy-making...
example.tran: 商界人士对变化无常的经济决策很是恼火。

example.ex: He was not displeased at the way he had handled the meeting.
example.tran: 他对他主持会议的方式并无不满。

means.word_mean: 1. not pleased; experiencing or manifesting displeasure

auth_sentence.content: He Himself could have killed those people if they displeased him.
auth_sentence.res_content: He Himself could have killed those people if they displeased him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He Himself could have killed those people if they displeased him.

auth_sentence.content: Mosby, a fanatic about ideas, displeased the institutional gentry.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mosby, a fanatic about ideas, displeased the institutional gentry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mosby, a fanatic about ideas, displeased the institutional gentry.

auth_sentence.content: The President, he said, appeared displeased with that answer.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The President, he said, appeared displeased with that answer.

means.word_mean: 不开心的,生气的;被得罪了的

sentences.en: He was displeased about the whole affair.
sentences.cn: 他对整个事情感到很不高兴。

sentences.en: The old man was displeased and darted an angry look at me.
sentences.cn: 老人不高兴了,瞪了我一眼。
